com.soen6441.core.play

Class Play

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • com.soen6441.core.play.Play
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IArchive, TimerListener

    public class Play
extends java.util.Observable
implements IArchive, TimerListener

    Introduction

    Play is the like the center data and logic of the game.

    Play contains GridMap and some shared information like coins and life



    Tasks

    Tasks - Using the object

    General Idea

    Play is using the singleton design pattern.

    The Play is kind of semi single. which means once the instance has been created, it can be destroyed and recreated. But there will be only zero / one object at runtime

    To get the play object

    Use currentPlay() method to get the instance.

    To destroy the play object

    When a play is finished, e.g. you quit from PlayingScene you should destroy the Play object.

    Use destroy() method to destroy the shared instance, so when someone call currentPlay() later, they will get a new one.



    Tasks - Managing the coins

    Getting and Setting the coins

    Use getCoins() and setCoins(int) to get and set the coins directly.

    If you want to increase or decrease the coins base on the logic, please use the following methods.

    To change the coins

    Use earnCoins(int) to increase the coins.

    Use spendCoins(int) to decrease the coins.

    Attention: Call getCoins() before call spendCoins(int) to check whether the coins is enough to spend



    Tasks - Being Observed

    General Idea

    This class has been adapted to the Observer Design Pattern.

    Some of the information could be observed by Observers.

    When it notifies observers, a extra object will be sent to indicate which information has been changed.

    Details

    Observers need to compare the second parameter in the Observer.update(Observable, Object) to the values below to know the detail.

    OBSERVABLE_EVENT_PROPERTY_COINS_DID_CHANGE This indicate that the coins has been changed.

    OBSERVABLE_EVENT_PROPERTY_LIFE_DID_CHANGE This indicate that the life has been changed.

    Version:
    $Revision: 1.0 $
    Author:
    Zhe Zhao, Mohammad Ali
